spatial_accuracy.notes: Multiple spatial mismatches between the 2D plan and 3D render. Main living/dining is roughly central as in plan, but several walls/partitions do not align to the same offsets, creating different room footprints (E2/E4). The primary entry on the bottom facade is shown as a single door placed left-of-center, whereas the plan indicates a centered double-door entry into the living space (E1/E2). Interior door locations and swing/orientation are inconsistent in several places (hall/bedroom/bath transitions), altering circulation (E2/E3). Window layout is substantially incorrect: the plan shows numerous facade windows/openings, but the 3D has fewer, with different spacing and sizes; some expected openings (notably on the bottom/left facades) are absent (E1/E2/E4). Several room proportions are distorted (central space and some bedrooms/corridors appear scaled differently than plan) (E4).

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thickness is mostly consistent in the 3D model (minor variation only). However, door embedding/placement is frequently incorrect relative to the plan (mislocated openings and different swing directions) (E2/E3). Adjacency is partially preserved (kitchen adjacent to living; bedrooms clustered right), but the exact hallway/bath/bed relationships are altered by shifted partitions and openings (E2). At least one planned exterior/ancillary space is not faithfully represented (e.g., terrace/balcony/opening configurations differ) (E1/E2). Some spaces read as added/reinterpreted rooms/alcoves (e.g., furnished nook-like areas) that do not match the plan as distinct rooms (E5).

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture is only loosely mapped to the plan. While major categories exist (kitchen, dining table, beds), placement/orientation differs from the 2D symbols (e.g., living seating layout, bedroom layouts, and kitchen arrangement) (E2/E3). Scale feels inconsistent in places (oversized central seating relative to circulation; some rooms appear too tight/too open compared to plan intent) (E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric camera view is appropriate and readable. Projection is mostly consistent (minor perspective feel but acceptable for an isometric-style render). Lighting is adequate but flat, with limited shadow definition. Geometry is generally clean with no major mesh distortions. Overall composition is clear; however, sparse/incorrect window depiction and simplified detailing reduce architectural clarity.

detected_errors.description: Main entry door placement differs: 3D shows a single door left-of-center; 2D plan indicates a centered double-door entry on the bottom facade.
Missing double-door element at the main entry as shown on the 2D plan.
Multiple interior doors are positioned differently than the 2D plan (hall/bed/bath transitions), changing circulation paths.
Several door swing orientations do not match the plan (opens into different rooms/directions).
Window/opening elements shown in the 2D plan are missing on several facades in the 3D render (notably bottom/left areas).
Window placement and spacing on the right/top facades do not match the 2D plan’s window locations.
Room proportions are distorted: central living/dining and some corridor/bedroom dimensions appear scaled differently from the 2D plan.
Wall/partition alignment differs from the plan in several areas, producing altered room footprints and corner conditions.
Exterior/ancillary space configuration (balcony/terrace/opening regions) is not faithfully preserved relative to the 2D plan.
Additional interpreted/furnished nook-like spaces appear as distinct areas in 3D that are not clearly defined as rooms in the 2D plan.
Furniture layout (living seating, kitchen arrangement, and some bedroom furniture) does not match the 2D plan symbols/positions.
Furniture scale inconsistencies relative to room sizes/circulation (central seating and some room clearances).
